item.title: elementary OS 7 is Getting Closer to Release
item.description: The team behind elementary OS has announced they are now focused on putting the finishing touches on the next major release of the Linux distribution.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Nitrux 2.5 Released with Kernel 6.0 and KDE Plasma 5.26
item.description: Nitrux 2.5 has been officially released and is the first systemd-free distribution to include both kernel 6.0 and KDE Plasma 5.26.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Zorin OS 16.02 Now Available
item.description: Zorin OS 16.2 has been officially released just seven months after the first point release of the user-friendly Linux operating system.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Linus Torvalds Considers Dropping i486 Support
item.description: In a message to the Linux kernel mailing list, creator Linus Torvalds indicates that it's time to jettison support for i486 machines in with Linux kernel.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Firefox 106 Lands with Back-Forward Swipe Gesture Support
item.description: The latest release of Firefox is out, and it adds two important new features to the open source browser.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: First Release Candidate of Linux 6.1 Kernel Announced
item.description: The development cycle for the 6.1 Linux kernel is off and running with the availability of the first Release Candidate.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Juno Computers Announces New Tablet for Preorder
item.description: Juno Computers brings to market one of the first commercial Linux tablets that could be consumer-friendly and a viable option for those wanting an open source mobile device.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: VirtualBox 7.0 Now Available for Installation
item.description: One of the most popular virtual machine applications for Linux has been upgraded to a major new release that offers an overhauled UI and some pretty important features.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: TUXEDO Computers Releases TUXEDO OS
item.description: The Linux hardware vendor TUXEDO Computers has announced the official release of its Ubuntu-based TUXEDO OS to the general public.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Native GPU Driver for Apple Silicon Is Nearly Here
item.description: Full-blown Linux on the Apple M1 and M2 chips is almost a reality.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: Linux Kernel 6.0 Officially Released
item.description: Although it will be some time before most Linux distributions ship with the latest kernel, the next major release is now available.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: ExTiX 22.9 Released with Support for Installing Android Apps
item.description: The developers of the ExTiX Linux Distribution have released a new version that includes added support to make installing and using Android apps on the desktop a breeze.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Gwen Clark)

item.title: System76 Skips Pop!_OS 22.10 to Focus on COSMIC Desktop
item.description: In a move that is sure to raise some eyebrows, System76 has chosen to concentrate on COSMIC Desktop instead of staying in step with Ubuntu releases.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Lori White)

item.title: New Look for System76 Thelio
item.description: System76 has given their already stellar Thelio desktop computer a redesign by way of the chassis accent panel.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Ubuntu Software Store Rumored to Replace Gnome Software
item.description: An alternative to GNOME Software has been written, using Flutter, and it’s making enough noise that Canonical is rumored to be considering using it as the default.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Dena Friesen)

item.title: A New Arch-Based Linux Distribution Has Arrived
item.description: Crystal Linux is a new distribution with the goal of bringing the power of Arch Linux to the masses.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Lori White)

item.title: Fedora 37 Beta Available
item.description: The Fedora development team announced the beta for version 37 of the open-source operating system would be released on time on September 13, 2022.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Lori White)

item.title: Salix 15.0 Offers Updates and a Modernized Look
item.description: Salix is a Slackware-based Linux distribution with a new look and a goal of being fast, user-friendly, and highly stable.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)

item.title: Ubuntu 20.04.5 LTS Release Now Available
item.description: The latest point release of the Ubuntu 20.04 LTS distribution is now available and sports kernel 5.15.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Lori White)

item.title: MX Linux 21.2 Offers Improvements and Bug Fixes
item.description: MX Linux 21.2, aka “Wildflower,” is now officially available and is the second refresh of the MX-21 release.
item.author: webdevel@sparkhausmedia.com (Amy Pettle)
